Material used.Description: Human SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were used for the experiment.

Readout description.Result Description: Wild-type PINK1 protected cells from staurosporine-induced apoptosis, while PINK1A244G did not.
Wild-type PINK1 protected cells from staurosporine-induced apoptosis, while PINK1V317I did not.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was replicated in three independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with post hoc multiple comparisons using Bonferroni correction was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Less than 36% TUNEL-positive cells under staurosporine treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: More than 36% TUNEL-positive cells under staurosporine treatment.
